task_summary: Detect the pink cloth, grasp an edge, drag it to fold, press the fold, release, and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A single PR2-like arm manipulates a pink cloth on a wooden tabletop. The goal is to fold the cloth by grasping one edge, lifting slightly, and dragging/pushing it over itself to create a clear crease. The sequence emphasizes careful approach, gentle contact, and a short lift followed by an in-plane push to achieve the fold. After forming the fold near the cloth center, the gripper presses to set the crease, releases the cloth, and retreats to a safe height, leaving the folded cloth on the table.
preconditions: Cloth is visible on the table
Workspace is free of obstacles around the cloth
Table surface provides sufficient friction for folding by push/drag
stepwise_plan: Perceive and localize the cloth and a foldable edge.
Open the gripper and move above the target edge.
Align, descend until contact, and close the gripper on the edge.
Lift slightly and push/drag the edge across the cloth to fold.
Press at the fold center to set the crease.
Open gripper and retreat to a safe pose.
success_criteria: A visible, stable fold is formed
Robot ends at a safe, non-contact pose
failure_and_recovery: Cloth not detected: re-perceive or adjust view
Missed grasp: reopen, realign, and retry approach
Slip during push: reduce speed or re-grasp closer to edge
Insufficient fold: repeat push/press from corrected start
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when fold is formed and the arm has released the cloth and retreated safely.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Perceive the cloth on the table.
Align tool to edge before contact.
Descend until contact with the cloth.
Drag the edge across to create the fold.
Press along the fold to set the crease.
Back away to a safe pose.

failure_modes: Cloth not localized or partially occluded
Edge grasp fails due to insufficient pinch
Cloth slips during push causing misfold
Press not applied at fold center
recovery_strategy: Re-run detection from a slightly different hover pose
Reduce push distance and repeat in smaller increments
Re-press near fold center and verify crease
assumptions: Frames suggest a push/drag based fold with a single gripper; no two-point pick-and-place is available.
Friction between cloth and table is sufficient for folding via dragging.
Exact fold line is approximated by the pose_key 'fold_center' inferred from visuals.

expected_success_criteria: No cloth edges extend beyond workspace
